events.title: Discovery of Cuba by Christopher Columbus
events.description: Christopher Columbus landed on the island of Cuba during his first voyage to the New World, marking a significant moment in the Age of Exploration.
events.significance: This event contributed to European awareness of the Americas and initiated Spanish colonization efforts in the Caribbean.

events.title: Dedication of the Statue of Liberty
events.description: The Statue of Liberty was officially dedicated by President Grover Cleveland in New York Harbor as a gift from France symbolizing freedom and democracy.
events.significance: It became an enduring symbol of freedom and immigration to the United States.

events.title: Czechoslovakia Declares Independence
events.description: Czechoslovakia declared its independence from the Austro-Hungarian Empire, forming a new sovereign nation after World War I.
events.significance: Marked the creation of a new democratic state in Central Europe and contributed to the reshaping of Europe after the war.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis Ends
events.description: After a tense 13-day confrontation, the Soviet Union agreed to dismantle missile bases in Cuba, averting nuclear war with the United States.
events.significance: This event eased the immediate threat of nuclear conflict and led to improved communication between the superpowers.
